intro: Chnoophora villosa, commonly known as the hairy chnoophora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
